Details: “Making biryani from scratch can take time and effort however with National’s famous Sindhi biryani mix, we guarantee you will be indulging in Daigi style traditional biryani without the extra hassle. This recipe mix will ensure your chicken/meat and potatoes are cooked in our perfect blend of spices and herbs that give maximum flavour and heat with each grain of rice infused in fragrant aroma that you just can’t resist!
Recipe:
Sindhi Biryani Recipe Mix is a convenient product that contains pre-measured spices and other ingredients needed to prepare Sindhi-style biryani. Here's a step-by-step recipe to make Sindhi Biryani using the mix:

Ingredients:
1. Sindhi Biryani Recipe Mix (1 packet)
2. Basmati rice (2 cups)
3. Vegetable oil (2 tbsp)
4. Water (3 cups)
5. Raisins (1/2 tbsp)
6. Cashews (1/2 tbsp)
7. Sliced onions (1 large)
8. Sliced tomatoes (2 medium)
9. Green chilies (2-3)
10. Salt to taste
11. Garam masala (1 tsp, optional)
12. Fresh cilantro (for garnish)
13. Boiled eggs (optional)
14. Cooked chickpeas (optional)
15. Sliced potatoes (optional)

Instructions:
1. Rinse the Basmati rice under cold water until the water runs clear. Drain the rice and set aside.
2. Heat 1 tbsp of vegetable oil in a large, deep pot or pressure cooker over medium heat.
3. Add the raisins and cashews. Fry them until they are golden brown, stirring occasionally. Remove them from the pot and set aside.
4. Add another tbsp of vegetable oil to the pot. Add the sliced onions and sauté until they turn golden brown.
5. Add the sliced tomatoes, green chilies, and salt to the pot. Cook until the tomatoes are soft and mushy.
6. Add the Sindhi Biryani Recipe Mix to the pot. Stir well to combine the mixture with the onions, tomatoes, and spices.
7. Add 2 cups of water to the pot and mix well.
8. Add the rinsed Basmati rice to the pot. Stir gently to ensure that the rice is well coated with the spice mixture.
9. If using optional ingredients like boiled eggs, cooked chickpeas, or sliced potatoes, add them to the pot at this point.
10. Cover the pot and cook over medium heat until the water is absorbed and the rice is cooked. This usually takes about 20-25 minutes in a pressure cooker or 45-50 minutes on the stovetop.
11. Once the rice is cooked, fluff it with a fork. Sprinkle the fried raisins and cashews over the rice.
12. Garnish with fresh cilantro. Serve hot with raita or yogurt.

Enjoy your Sindhi Biryani! Remember that the exact cooking time may vary depending on your stove and cookware. Taste the rice occasionally to ensure it's cooked to your liking.
Ingredients: Here are the ingredients listed in the Sindhi Biryani Recipe:

Details: Prepare delicious Pulao in no time with the help of National Pulao Mix. Mixed with varieties of herbs and spices, this mix adds a fragrant aroma and wholesome flavour to every grain of rice and meat. Create your own variation of Pulao with our mix as this can be added to chicken, meat, chickpeas and/or vegetables. Best served with Raita.
Recipe:
Pulao Recipe Mix is a convenient product that contains pre-mixed spices and seasonings for making a traditional Indian dish called Pulao. Here's a simple recipe to use it:

Ingredients:
1. 2 cups of basmati rice
2. 4 cups of water
3. 2 tablespoons of vegetable oil
4. 1 large onion, finely chopped
5. 2 cloves of garlic, minced
6. 1 inch piece of ginger, grated
7. 1 green chili, sliced (optional)
8. 1 cup of mixed vegetables (like peas, carrots, and corn)
9. 1 cup of your preferred protein (like chicken, lamb, or paneer)
10. 1 packet of Pulao Recipe Mix
11. Salt to taste
12. Fresh cilantro for garnish

Instructions:
1. Rinse the basmati rice under cold water until the water runs clear. Drain the excess water.
2. Heat the vegetable oil in a large pot over medium heat. Add the chopped onions, minced garlic, grated ginger, and sliced green chili (if using). Sauté until the onions are translucent.
3. Add the mixed vegetables and sauté for a few minutes until they start to soften.
4. If you're using protein, add it to the pot and cook until it's browned. Stir occasionally to prevent sticking.
5. Add the rinsed basmati rice to the pot. Stir well to coat the rice with the oil and vegetables.
6. Add the Pulao Recipe Mix packet to the pot. Stir again to ensure the rice is evenly coated.
7. Pour in 4 cups of water and add salt to taste. Stir once.
8. Bring the mixture to a boil, then reduce heat to low, cover the pot, and let it simmer for 18-20 minutes, or until the water is fully absorbed and the rice is cooked. Do not stir the rice during this time.
9. Once the rice is cooked, remove the pot from heat and let it sit, covered, for 5 minutes.
10. Fluff the rice with a fork and garnish with fresh cilantro before serving.

Enjoy your homemade Pulao with your favorite accompaniments like raita, pickle, or curry!
Ingredients: 8. 1 cup of mixed vegetables (like peas, carrots, and corn)
9. 1 cup of your preferred protein (like chicken, lamb, or paneer)

Details: Making biryani from scratch can take time and effort however with National\’s famous Biryani mix, we guarantee you will be indulging in Daigi style traditional biryani without the extra hassle. This recipe mix will ensure your chicken/meat and potatoes are cooked in our perfect blend of spices and herbs that give maximum flavour and heat with each grain of rice infused in fragrant aroma that you just can\’t resist
Recipe:
Sure! Here's a recipe for making Biryani using a Biryani Recipe Mix:

Ingredients:
1. 1 packet of Biryani Recipe Mix
2. 2 cups of basmati rice
3. 4 cups of water
4. 1 lb (450g) of boneless, skinless chicken breasts, cut into bite-sized pieces
5. 2 medium-sized onions, finely chopped
6. 2 tomatoes, finely chopped
7. 2 green chilies, finely chopped
8. 2 cloves of garlic, minced
9. 1 inch piece of ginger, minced
10. 2 tbsp of vegetable oil
11. 1 tsp of cumin seeds
12. 1 tsp of coriander seeds
13. 1 tsp of fennel seeds
14. 6 cloves
15. 2 green cardamoms
16. 1 black cardamom
17. 2 bay leaves
18. Salt to taste
19. 1 cup of frozen peas
20. 1 cup of sliced almonds
21. Fresh coriander leaves for garnish
22. 2 boiled eggs, sliced (optional)

Instructions:
1. Rinse the basmati rice under cold water until the water runs clear. Soak the rice in water for 20-30 minutes. Drain the water and set aside.
2. Heat 2 tbsp of oil in a large, deep pot over medium heat. Add the cumin seeds, coriander seeds, fennel seeds, cloves, green cardamoms, black cardamom, and bay leaves. Stir until fragrant.
3. Add the chopped onions, green chilies, garlic, and ginger to the pot. Sauté until the onions are translucent.
4. Add the chicken pieces to the pot and stir until they are coated with the onion mixture. Cook until the chicken is no longer pink.
5. Add the chopped tomatoes to the pot and stir well. Cook until the tomatoes are soft.
6. Add the Biryani Recipe Mix to the pot and stir well. Follow the instructions on the packet for the amount of water to add. Usually, it is 4 cups of water for 2 cups of rice. Stir well to ensure the mix is evenly distributed.
7. Add the drained basmati rice to the pot and stir gently. Season with salt to taste.
8. Stir in the frozen peas and sliced almonds.
9. Bring the mixture to a boil, then reduce the heat to low, cover the pot, and let it simmer for 15-20 minutes, or until the rice is fully cooked and the water has been absorbed.
10. Turn off the heat and let the biryani rest for 5-10 minutes before fluffing it with a fork and serving.
11. Garnish with fresh coriander leaves and sliced boiled eggs (if using).

Enjoy your Biryani!
Ingredients: 4. 1 lb (450g) of boneless, skinless chicken breasts, cut into bite-sized pieces

Recipe:
Ingredients:
1. Bombay Biryani Recipe Mix (contains basmati rice, spices, and other seasonings)
2. 1 lb (454g) boneless chicken breasts, cut into bite-size pieces
3. 1 large onion, finely chopped
4. 2 cloves garlic, minced
5. 1 inch ginger, grated
6. 2 green chilies, finely chopped (adjust according to spice preference)
7. 1 cup (237ml) yogurt
8. 1 cup (237ml) water
9. 1 cup (237ml) vegetable oil
10. 1 cup (120g) frozen peas
11. 1 cup (120g) sliced almonds
12. 1 cup (120g) raisins
13. 2 boiled eggs, halved
14. Fresh coriander leaves for garnishing
15. Salt to taste

Instructions:
1. Rinse the basmati rice that comes with the Bombay Biryani Recipe Mix under cold water until the water runs clear. Set aside.
2. In a large bowl, combine the chicken, onion, garlic, ginger, green chilies, yogurt, and salt. Mix well and let it marinate for at least 30 minutes or up to 4 hours in the refrigerator.
3. Heat 2 tablespoons of oil in a large pot or pressure cooker over medium heat. Add the marinated chicken and cook until it's browned on all sides. Remove the chicken from the pot and set aside.
4. In the same pot, heat 2 more tablespoons of oil. Add the Bombay Biryani Recipe Mix and stir for 1 minute until fragrant.
5. Add the marinated onion-garlic mixture to the pot and cook until the onions become translucent.
6. Stir in the rinsed basmati rice and cook for 1-2 minutes.
7. Pour the water into the pot and stir well to combine. Add the cooked chicken, peas, almonds, raisins, and half of the coriander leaves. Stir gently.
8. If using a pressure cooker, close the lid and cook for 10 minutes at high pressure. Let the pressure release naturally. If using a regular pot, bring the mixture to a boil, reduce heat to low, cover, and simmer for 20-25 minutes or until the rice is fully cooked and most of the liquid has been absorbed.
9. Fluff the rice with a fork, and gently mix in the boiled eggs.
10. Transfer the biryani to a serving dish, garnish with the remaining coriander leaves, and serve hot.

Enjoy your delicious Bombay Biryani!

Details: Add excitement to the dining table by serving delicious authentic Karahi Gosht with the help of National karahi gosht Recipe Mix. A flavorful blend of spices and herbs that delivers aroma and flavorsome taste. Now serve restaurant quality food from the comfort of your home.
Recipe:
Karahi Gosht Recipe Mix is a ready-made spice blend commonly used in Pakistani and Indian cuisine to make Karahi Gosht, a popular dish of marinated meat cooked in a wok-like pan called a karahi. Here's a simple recipe to make Karahi Gosht using this mix:

Ingredients:
1. 1 lb (450g) boneless lamb or beef, cut into cubes
2. 3 tbsp (45ml) vegetable oil
3. 1 large onion, finely chopped
4. 2-3 cloves garlic, minced
5. 1-inch piece of ginger, grated
6. 1-2 green chili peppers, seeded and finely chopped (optional)
7. 1 cup (240ml) plain yogurt
8. 1 packet of Karahi Gosht Recipe Mix
9. 1 cup (240ml) water
10. Salt to taste
11. 2 tomatoes, chopped (optional)
12. Fresh coriander leaves for garnish

Instructions:
1. Wash and pat dry the meat cubes, then season them with salt. Set aside.
2. Heat the oil in a karahi or a large, deep skillet over medium-high heat. Once hot, add the onions, garlic, ginger, and green chili peppers (if using). Sauté until the onions are translucent and the garlic and ginger are aromatic.
3. Add the marinated meat to the pan and cook until it starts to brown. Stir occasionally to prevent sticking.
4. In a separate bowl, mix the Karahi Gosht Recipe Mix with the yogurt, making sure there are no lumps. Add this mixture to the pan, stirring well to coat the meat evenly.
5. Add the water to the pan and bring the mixture to a boil. Reduce heat to low, cover, and let it simmer for about 30-40 minutes, or until the meat is tender. Stir occasionally to prevent burning.
6. If you prefer, you can add chopped tomatoes at this stage and cook for an additional 5 minutes.
7. Taste the dish and adjust the seasoning with salt if needed. Garnish with fresh coriander leaves before serving.

Enjoy your Karahi Gosht! Keep in mind that the cooking time may vary depending on the cut and thickness of the meat. Always ensure the meat is fully cooked before serving.
Ingredients: 1. 1 lb (450g) boneless lamb or beef, cut into cubes
6. 1-2 green chili peppers, seeded and finely chopped (optional)
8. 1 packet of Karahi Gosht Recipe Mix

Details: Prepare traditional chatkharidar Achar Gosht in no time with the help of National Achar Gosht Masala Mix. Mixed with varieties of herbs and spices, this mix adds a fragrant aroma and a spicy tangy flavour of pickles to your meat.
Recipe:
Achar Gosht Recipe Mix is a ready-made spice blend traditionally used in Pakistani and Indian cuisine to prepare a tangy and spicy dish called Achar Gosht. This mix often contains a blend of spices, tamarind paste, and other seasonings. Here's a simple recipe using the Achar Gosht Recipe Mix to prepare Achar Gosht:

Ingredients:
1. 500g of boneless lamb or goat meat, cut into cubes
2. 3 tablespoons of Achar Gosht Recipe Mix
3. 2 medium-sized onions, finely chopped
4. 2-3 cloves of garlic, minced
5. 1-inch piece of ginger, peeled and grated
6. 2 green chilies, slit
7. 1 cup of water
8. 1 tablespoon of vegetable oil
9. 1 tablespoon of ghee (clarified butter), optional
10. Salt to taste
11. 2 tablespoons of chopped cilantro (coriander leaves) for garnish

Instructions:
1. Rinse the meat cubes under cold water and pat dry with a kitchen towel. Set aside.
2. Heat a large skillet or Dutch oven over medium-high heat. Add the vegetable oil and swirl to coat the bottom of the pan.
3. Once the oil is hot, add the meat cubes in a single layer. Sear on all sides until lightly browned. Remove the seared meat from the pan and set it aside.
4. In the same skillet, add a little more oil if necessary. Add the finely chopped onions, minced garlic, and grated ginger. Sauté until the onions turn golden brown.
5. Add the slit green chilies to the skillet and stir-fry for a minute.
6. Return the seared meat to the skillet. Sprinkle the Achar Gosht Recipe Mix evenly over the meat and onions. Mix well to coat the meat with the spice mix.
7. Add 1 cup of water and salt to taste. Stir well to combine. Reduce the heat to low, cover the skillet, and let it simmer for 30-40 minutes or until the meat is tender and fully cooked.
8. After the meat is cooked, stir in the chopped cilantro. If desired, add a tablespoon of ghee for an additional rich flavor.
9. Serve Achar Gosht hot with rice or naan bread.

Enjoy your tasty Achar Gosht dish made with the Achar Gosht Recipe Mix!
Ingredients: 1. 500g of boneless lamb or goat meat, cut into cubes
2. 3 tablespoons of Achar Gosht Recipe Mix
5. 1-inch piece of ginger, peeled and grated
10. 2 tablespoons of chopped cilantro (coriander leaves) for garnish

Details: Prepare traditional Daigi style Quorma with National Quorma Recipe Mix. A combination of rich and fragrant spices and herbs that helps you prepare a delicious quorma in no time! Includes a Free ” National Bombay Biryani Recipe Mix” Sachet in the box, to add more to your dinner table.
Recipe:
Quorma is a popular Pakistani dish that is often made with meat, vegetables, and a variety of spices. National Foods offers a Quorma Recipe Mix that can make the process of making Quorma at home easier and more convenient. Here's a detailed recipe and a list of ingredients for making Quorma using the Quorma Recipe Mix from National Foods:

Ingredients:
1. National Foods Quorma Recipe Mix - 1 packet (approximately 200g)
2. Vegetable oil - 2 tablespoons
3. Onions - 2 large, finely chopped
4. Garlic - 2 cloves, minced
5. Ginger - 1 inch piece, grated
6. Tomatoes - 2 medium, chopped
7. Green chilies - 2, slit
8. Water - 3 cups
9. Salt to taste
10. Coriander leaves - fresh, chopped for garnish

Instructions:
1. Heat 2 tablespoons of vegetable oil in a large pot over medium heat.
2. Add the finely chopped onions, minced garlic, and grated ginger to the pot. Sauté until the onions turn golden brown.
3. Add the chopped tomatoes and slit green chilies to the pot. Cook until the tomatoes are soft and mushy.
4. Add the National Foods Quorma Recipe Mix to the pot and stir well to combine with the onion-tomato mixture.
5. Pour 3 cups of water into the pot and stir well.
6. Season with salt to taste.
7. Bring the mixture to a boil, then reduce the heat and let it simmer for 10-15 minutes, until the Quorma mix has thickened.
8. Garnish with fresh coriander leaves before serving.

Enjoy your homemade Quorma with rice or naan bread. You can also add your favorite protein such as chicken, beef, or lamb to the Quorma recipe if you prefer a non-vegetarian version.
Ingredients: 1. National Foods Quorma Recipe Mix - 1 packet (approximately 200g)
10. Coriander leaves - fresh, chopped for garnish

Details: Prepare delicious Paya salan with the help of National Paya Recipe Mix. A perfect blend of aromatic and rich herbs and spices creating a flavorsome traditional meal. An ideal dish to serve in dawat and events in the winter season.
Recipe:
Paya Recipe Mix is a ready-made product used primarily in Filipino and other Southeast Asian cuisines to prepare payatas, also known as beef tripe stew. Here's a simple recipe using Paya Recipe Mix:

Ingredients:
1. Paya Recipe Mix (as per package instructions)
2. 1 kg beef tripe, cleaned and sliced
3. 4 cups water
4. 1 large onion, sliced
5. 2-3 cloves garlic, minced
6. 2-3 pieces of bay leaves
7. 1 tablespoon oil
8. Salt to taste

Instructions:
1. In a large pot, heat oil over medium heat. Add sliced onions and minced garlic, sauté until fragrant.
2. Add the beef tripe to the pot and cook until it starts to change color. Stir occasionally to prevent burning.
3. Pour in 4 cups of water, then add the Paya Recipe Mix according to the package instructions. Stir until the mix dissolves completely.
4. Add bay leaves and season with salt to taste.
5. Bring the mixture to a boil, then reduce heat to low, cover the pot, and let it simmer for about 1-1.5 hours, or until the tripe is tender. Stir occasionally to prevent the mixture from sticking to the bottom of the pot.
6. Once the tripe is tender, you can serve the payatas hot with steamed rice. Optional add-ins include chopped green onions, chili flakes, or soy sauce.

Enjoy your Paya Recipe Mix stew! Remember, though, that every cook has their unique touch, so feel free to personalize this recipe to your taste preferences.
Ingredients: 1. Paya Recipe Mix (as per package instructions)
2. 1 kg beef tripe, cleaned and sliced

Details: Traditional mix of cumin, turmeric, ginger spices and dry herbs, blended to form the perfect home-made style curry mix. A delicious flavorsome desi taste and a fragrant aroma to make your meal burst with flavour. A perfect option for easy cooking & instant serving for any event.
Recipe:
Ingredients:
1. 2 tablespoons Curry Powder Recipe Mix
2. 1 lb (454g) boneless, skinless chicken breasts, cut into bite-sized pieces
3. 1 large onion, finely chopped
4. 2 cloves garlic, minced
5. 1 can (14 oz/398ml) diced tomatoes
6. 1 can (14 oz/398ml) chickpeas, drained and rinsed
7. 1 cup (240ml) coconut milk
8. 1 tablespoon vegetable oil
9. Salt to taste
10. Fresh cilantro for garnish

Instruction:
1. Heat the vegetable oil in a large skillet or Dutch oven over medium heat. Add the chicken pieces and cook until browned on all sides, about 5-7 minutes. Remove the chicken from the skillet and set aside.
2. In the same skillet, add the onions and garlic. Sauté until softened, about 3-4 minutes.
3. Stir in the Curry Powder Recipe Mix and cook for 1 minute, until fragrant.
4. Add the canned diced tomatoes, chickpeas, and cooked chicken back into the skillet. Stir to combine.
5. Pour in the coconut milk and stir well. Season with salt to taste.
6. Reduce heat to low, cover the skillet, and let it simmer for 20-25 minutes, until the flavors have melded together and the chicken is fully cooked.
7. Serve the chicken curry over rice or with naan bread. Garnish with fresh cilantro if desired.

Enjoy your Curry Powder Chicken dish!

Details: National Murghi Masala provides the ultimate blend of spices and herbs to give your Chicken Gravy a distinctive flavor and aroma. Conveniently prepare dishes without compromising on taste with help of our recipe mix.
Recipe:
Murghi Recipe Mix is a ready-made spice blend often used for making Indian-style chicken dishes. It typically contains a mix of various spices like turmeric, coriander, cumin, chili, garam masala, and other aromatics. Here's a simple recipe to make a popular Indian dish, Chicken Tikka Masala, using Murghi Recipe Mix:

Ingredients:
1. 500g boneless, skinless chicken breast, cut into 1-inch cubes
2. 2 tablespoons Murghi Recipe Mix
3. 1 cup yogurt (plain, full-fat)
4. 2 tablespoons lemon juice
5. 2 tablespoons vegetable oil
6. 1 large onion, finely chopped
7. 2 cloves garlic, minced
8. 1 tablespoon grated ginger
9. 1 green bell pepper, chopped
10. 1 can (400g) crushed tomatoes
11. 1 cup water
12. Salt to taste
13. 2 tablespoons chopped fresh cilantro for garnish
14. 2 tablespoons heavy cream (optional)

Instructions:
1. In a large bowl, combine chicken cubes, Murghi Recipe Mix, yogurt, and lemon juice. Mix well, ensuring all the chicken pieces are well-coated. Cover the bowl and marinate in the refrigerator for at least 3 hours, or ideally overnight for better flavor.

2. Heat oil in a large non-stick skillet over medium-high heat. Add the marinated chicken pieces and cook until browned on all sides, approximately 5-7 minutes. Remove the chicken from the skillet and set aside.

3. In the same skillet, sauté the onion, garlic, and ginger until softened and fragrant, about 2-3 minutes. Add the bell pepper and cook for an additional 2 minutes.

4. Stir in the crushed tomatoes and water. Season with salt to taste. Bring the mixture to a boil, then reduce heat to low, cover, and simmer for 10-15 minutes, until the sauce thickens.

5. Add the cooked chicken back into the skillet with the sauce and mix well. Cook for an additional 5 minutes to allow the flavors to meld together. If you prefer a creamier sauce, stir in the heavy cream at this point.

6. Garnish with fresh cilantro before serving, and enjoy your Chicken Tikka Masala with rice or naan bread.

Enjoy your meal!

Details: Prepare delicious kofta curry with the help of National Kofta Recipe Mix. A perfect blend of aromatic and rich herbs and spices that seasons and flavors the kofta meat perfectly.
Recipe:
Kofta Recipe Mix is a ready-made product that contains a blend of spices and seasonings, typically used to make kofta, which are meatballs or meat patties originating from the Middle East and South Asia. Here's a simple recipe to make kofta using Kofta Recipe Mix:

Ingredients:
1. 500g ground meat (beef, lamb, or a mix of both)
2. 1 packet of Kofta Recipe Mix
3. 1 small onion, finely chopped
4. 2 cloves of garlic, minced
5. 2 green chilies, finely chopped (optional)
6. 1 egg
7. 2 tbsp breadcrumbs
8. 2 tbsp vegetable oil
9. Salt to taste
10. Water as needed
11. Garnish: chopped cilantro, onions, and lemon wedges

Instructions:
1. In a large bowl, mix the ground meat, Kofta Recipe Mix, onion, garlic, green chilies, egg, breadcrumbs, and salt. The mixture should be slightly moist, so add water if needed.
2. Using your hands, shape the mixture into small meatballs or patties.
3. Heat the vegetable oil in a non-stick pan over medium heat. Once hot, carefully add the koftas and cook until they are golden brown on all sides. This usually takes about 5-7 minutes.
4. Drain the excess oil from the pan and set the cooked koftas aside on a plate lined with paper towels to absorb any remaining oil.
5. Serve the koftas with your choice of sauce or gravy, such as tomato sauce, yogurt sauce, or tikka masala. You can also serve them with rice, naan, or roti.
6. Garnish with chopped cilantro, onions, and lemon wedges before serving.

Enjoy your homemade koftas! Remember, the exact amount of water and other ingredients may vary depending on the specific Kofta Recipe Mix you're using, so always follow the instructions on the package.
Ingredients: 1. 500g ground meat (beef, lamb, or a mix of both)
11. Garnish: chopped cilantro, onions, and lemon wedges

Details: Indulge in traditional Delhi Nihari from the comfort of your home using National Delhi Nihari Recipe Mix; which is prepared by Pakistani cuisine experts; using the ultimate blend of spices and herbs.
Recipe:
Delhi Nihari is a popular North Indian dish, known for its rich and flavorful gravy made with tender slow-cooked beef or mutton. If you're looking to make this delicious dish using the Delhi Nihari Recipe Mix from National Foods, here's a step-by-step guide for you:

Ingredients:
1. National Foods Delhi Nihari Recipe Mix (1 packet, approximately 100g)
2. 500g beef or mutton (preferably boneless and cut into small pieces)
3. 2 cups of water
4. 1 large onion, finely chopped
5. 2-3 cloves of garlic, minced
6. 1-inch piece of ginger, minced
7. 1 green chili, finely chopped (optional)
8. 2 tablespoons vegetable oil
9. 1 teaspoon garam masala
10. Salt to taste
11. 1 cup yogurt (optional, for garnish)
12. 2-3 green coriander leaves, finely chopped (for garnish)
13. 1 lemon, cut into wedges (for serving)

Instructions:

1. Rinse the beef or mutton pieces under cold water and drain. Set aside.

2. Heat oil in a heavy-bottomed pot over medium heat. Add the chopped onions, garlic, ginger, and green chili (if using). Sauté until the onions turn golden brown, approximately 5-7 minutes.

3. Add the packaged Delhi Nihari Recipe Mix to the pot and stir well to combine with the onion mixture. Cook for 1-2 minutes, ensuring that the spices are well-coated with the oil.

4. Add the beef or mutton pieces to the pot and stir well. Coat the meat evenly with the spice mixture.

5. Pour 2 cups of water into the pot. Stir the mixture well, making sure that the meat pieces are completely submerged in water.

6. Cover the pot and let the mixture simmer on low heat for 1.5-2 hours, or until the meat is tender and easily breaks apart with a fork. Stir occasionally to prevent the mixture from sticking to the bottom of the pot.

7. Season with salt and garam masala. Stir well to ensure an even distribution of seasoning.

8. If desired, add the yogurt and let it cook for an additional 2-3 minutes. Be careful not to let the mixture boil after adding the yogurt.

9. Garnish with chopped green coriander leaves before serving. Serve Delhi Nihari with fresh lemon wedges.

Enjoy your homemade Delhi Nihari! Remember that the cooking time may vary depending on the cut and tenderness of the meat. Adjust the seasoning to taste, and feel free to experiment with other garnishes like chopped green chilies or fresh cilantro.
Ingredients: 1. National Foods Delhi Nihari Recipe Mix (1 packet, approximately 100g)
12. 2-3 green coriander leaves, finely chopped (for garnish)

Details: Indulge in a traditional BBQ by making delicious mouth watering tikka with National Tikka Boti Masala. A tantalizing blend of spices and fragrant herbs that helps make the meat tender and juicy. Now you can enjoy your favourite Tikka recipe at home without the extra hassle.
Recipe:
Tikka Boti Recipe Mix is a convenient ingredient that contains a blend of spices used in Indian cooking, specifically for making Tikka Boti, a popular North Indian dish. Here's a simple recipe using the mix:

Ingredients:
1. Tikka Boti Recipe Mix (as per package instructions)
2. 500g Boneless Chicken Breast, cut into cubes
3. 1 large Onion, finely chopped
4. 2-3 cloves Garlic, minced
5. 1 inch Ginger, grated
6. 2 Green Chillies, finely chopped
7. 1 can (400g) Diced Tomatoes
8. 2 tbsp Vegetable Oil
9. Fresh Coriander Leaves for garnish
10. Salt to taste
11. 2 tbsp Yogurt (optional, for marination)

Instructions:
1. Rinse the chicken cubes under cold water and pat dry with a paper towel. If using yogurt for marination, mix it with half the Tikka Boti Recipe Mix and coat the chicken cubes evenly. Let it marinate for at least 30 minutes or up to 4 hours in the refrigerator.

2. Heat oil in a large skillet or wok over medium heat. Add the chopped onions and sauté until they turn golden brown.

3. Add the minced garlic, grated ginger, and green chillies to the skillet. Sauté for a minute until the raw aroma disappears.

4. Add the remaining Tikka Boti Recipe Mix to the skillet and stir well to combine with the onions and aromatics.

5. Add the diced tomatoes and their juice to the skillet. Stir well to mix in the spices.

6. If using marinated chicken, add it to the skillet now. If not, add the chicken cubes and sprinkle salt over them. Cook the chicken until it's fully cooked and the spices are well blended.

7. Stir occasionally to prevent the mixture from sticking to the bottom of the skillet. Cook until the oil starts to separate from the mix, indicating that the dish is ready.

8. Garnish with fresh coriander leaves before serving.

Enjoy your Tikka Boti with Naan bread, Basmati rice, or any other side dish of your choice!
Ingredients: The ingredients for this Tikka Boti recipe are:
1. Tikka Boti Recipe Mix (as per package instructions)
2. 500g Boneless Chicken Breast, cut into cubes

Details: Indulge in a traditional BBQ by using National’s Bihari Kabab Mix to create signature Bihari style kebabs with the perfect blend of hot spices for a delicious marinade. Now you can enjoy spicy, delicious Bihari Style BBQ meat without the extra hassle.
Recipe:
Seekh Kabab Recipe Mix is a convenient spice blend that simplifies the process of making Seekh Kababs, a popular dish from the Indian subcontinent. Here's a simple recipe using Seekh Kabab Recipe Mix:

Ingredients:
1. 500g ground lamb or beef
2. 1 large onion, finely chopped
3. 2-3 green chilies, finely chopped (adjust according to spiciness preference)
4. 2 cloves garlic, minced
5. 1 inch ginger, grated
6. 1 cup yogurt (preferably Greek yogurt for its thicker consistency)
7. 1 packet Seekh Kabab Recipe Mix
8. 2 tbsp oil for frying
9. Salt to taste
10. Skewers (soaked in water for at least 30 minutes)

Instructions:
1. In a large bowl, combine the ground meat, finely chopped onion, green chilies, minced garlic, grated ginger, and a pinch of salt. Mix thoroughly.
2. Add the Seekh Kabab Recipe Mix to the meat mixture and mix well.
3. Add the yogurt to the meat mixture and combine. Ensure that all the spices are evenly distributed throughout the meat.
4. Cover the bowl with a clean cloth and let the meat mixture marinate in the refrigerator for at least 2 hours or overnight for best results.
5. Preheat your grill or broiler. If using a grill, oil the grates. If using a broiler, line a baking sheet with aluminum foil and brush with oil.
6. Shape the marinated meat mixture into long, thin sausages, wrapping each around the soaked skewers.
7. Place the skewers on the grill or broiler and cook for about 6-8 minutes on each side, or until the outside is browned and the inside is cooked through.
8. Serve Seekh Kababs hot with naan bread, rice, or any side of your choice. Enjoy!

Note: You can also pan-fry the Seekh Kababs in a non-stick skillet with a little oil, if you do not have access to a grill or broiler. Cook on medium heat for about 6-8 minutes on each side.
Ingredients: 3. 2-3 green chilies, finely chopped (adjust according to spiciness preference)
6. 1 cup yogurt (preferably Greek yogurt for its thicker consistency)
10. Skewers (soaked in water for at least 30 minutes)

Details: Indulge in a traditional desi BBQ by using National’s Chicken Tandoori Mix to create signature tandoori with the perfect blend of hot spices for succulant and juicy chicken. Now you can enjoy authentic spicy and delicious chicken tandoori at home without the extra hassle.
Recipe:
Chicken Tandoori is a popular Indian dish known for its delicious flavor and vibrant color. Chicken Tandori Recipe Mix is a convenient product that can help you prepare this dish at home. Here's a simple recipe using Chicken Tandoori Recipe Mix:

Ingredients:
1. 1 kg (2.2 lbs) boneless chicken breasts or thighs, cut into pieces
2. 1 cup yogurt
3. 1 packet (about 50-60g) Chicken Tandoori Recipe Mix
4. 3-4 tablespoons vegetable oil
5. 1 large onion, finely chopped
6. 2-3 cloves garlic, minced
7. 1-inch piece of ginger, grated
8. 2 green chilies, finely chopped
9. Fresh cilantro for garnish
10. Lemon wedges for serving

Instructions:
1. In a large bowl, mix the chicken pieces with half of the yogurt. Massage the yogurt into the chicken to ensure it's well-coated. Let it marinate for at least 2 hours, or overnight if possible.
2. In a separate bowl, mix the Chicken Tandoori Recipe Mix with the remaining yogurt to form a paste.
3. Heat vegetable oil in a large skillet or wok over medium heat. Add the chopped onion, garlic, ginger, and green chilies. Sauté until the onions are translucent.
4. Add the Tandoori paste to the skillet, stirring continuously until the paste is well-incorporated with the onions.
5. Remove the marinated chicken from the bowl, letting the excess marinade drip off. Add the chicken to the skillet and coat it evenly with the Tandoori paste.
6. Cook the chicken on medium heat, stirring occasionally, until it's fully cooked and the paste has formed a crust. This should take about 10-15 minutes.
7. Garnish with fresh cilantro and serve with lemon wedges.

Enjoy your homemade Chicken Tandoori! Remember, you can adjust the recipe to your taste preferences, such as adding more or less spice, or using chicken breast or thighs.
Ingredients: 1. 1 kg (2.2 lbs) boneless chicken breasts or thighs, cut into pieces

Details: Indulge in a traditional desi BBQ by using National’s Chicken Tikka Mix to create signature chicken tikka with the perfect blend of hot spices for succulant and juicy chicken. Now you can enjoy authentic spicy and delicious chicken tandoori at home without the extra hassle. This mix can be used as a seasoning or flavouring for other dishes like sandwiches, pasta and many more.
Recipe:
Chicken Tikka Recipe Mix is a convenient blend of spices and seasonings commonly used to make Chicken Tikka, a popular Indian dish. Here's a simple recipe using this mix:

Ingredients:
1. 500g (1.1 lbs) boneless, skinless chicken breasts, cut into 1-inch cubes
2. 120ml (1/2 cup) yogurt
3. 1 packet of Chicken Tikka Recipe Mix
4. 2 tablespoons vegetable oil
5. Salt, to taste
6. 1 large onion, thinly sliced
7. 1 large green bell pepper, sliced
8. 1 large tomato, sliced
9. Lemon wedges, for serving
10. Cilantro leaves, for garnish

Instructions:
1. In a large mixing bowl, combine the chicken cubes, yogurt, and the entire packet of Chicken Tikka Recipe Mix. Mix well to ensure all chicken pieces are evenly coated. Let the chicken marinate for at least 2 hours, or preferably overnight, in the refrigerator.

2. Preheat your oven's broiler to high. Line a baking sheet with aluminum foil and brush it with vegetable oil.

3. Remove the marinated chicken from the refrigerator, allowing it to come to room temperature while preheating the oven.

4. Arrange the marinated chicken cubes on the prepared baking sheet, ensuring they are not touching each other. Season with a little salt, if desired.

5. Broil the chicken for 5-7 minutes, or until the outside is golden brown and slightly charred. Flip the chicken cubes over and broil for another 5-7 minutes until cooked through.

6. While the chicken is broiling, heat some oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add the sliced onion, bell pepper, and tomato. Sauté until the vegetables are softened and slightly caramelized.

7. Once the chicken is cooked, serve it with the sautéed vegetables and lemon wedges. Garnish with cilantro leaves before serving.

Enjoy your homemade Chicken Tikka!
Ingredients: Here are the ingredients listed in the recipe:
1. 500g (1.1 lbs) boneless, skinless chicken breasts, cut into 1-inch cubes
3. 1 packet of Chicken Tikka Recipe Mix

Details: Create your favourite spicy Fish recipe with the help of National Fish Recipe Mix. A blend of flavorful spices and fragrant herbs to make the perfect marination for any kind of fish. Helps in tenderizing and absorbing flavour. Perfect for fried, grilled and roasted fish.
Recipe:
Ingredients:
1. 1 lb (454g) fresh or frozen white fish fillets (such as cod, halibut, or tilapia)
2. 2 cups (473ml) water
3. 1 packet Fish Recipe Mix
4. 2 tablespoons (30ml) vegetable oil
5. Salt to taste
6. Lemon wedges and chopped fresh parsley for garnish (optional)

Instructions:
1. If using frozen fish fillets, thaw them in the refrigerator overnight or in cold water for about 30 minutes. Pat dry with a paper towel.
2. In a large saucepan, bring 2 cups of water to a boil over medium-high heat.
3. Add the Fish Recipe Mix packet to the boiling water and stir until completely dissolved.
4. Reduce heat to medium-low, then add the fish fillets to the saucepan.
5. Cook the fish in the seasoned water for 5-7 minutes, or until the fish is opaque and flakes easily with a fork.
6. Remove the saucepan from heat and let the fish sit in the seasoned water for an additional 2 minutes.
7. Using a slotted spoon, carefully remove the fish fillets from the saucepan and place them on a serving platter.
8. Heat the vegetable oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat.
9. If desired, season the cooked fish fillets with salt to taste.
10. Brown the fish fillets on both sides in the hot oil for 1-2 minutes, or until golden brown.
11. Serve the seasoned and browned fish fillets with lemon wedges and chopped fresh parsley for garnish, if desired.
12. Enjoy your Fish Recipe Mix-seasoned fish!
Ingredients: 1. 1 lb (454g) fresh or frozen white fish fillets (such as cod, halibut, or tilapia)
5. Salt (quantity not specified, but mentioned for seasoning)

Details: National’s Shami Kabab Recipe Mix helps you prepare delicious shami Kababs at home with the perfect blend mix of spices and herbs to give you that authentic flavour. Now you can enjoy home made spicy, mouth watering Shami Kababs without the extra hassle.
Recipe:
Shami Kabab is a popular Indian dish made of ground lamb or beef, spices, and sometimes, bread crumbs. Here's a simple recipe to make Shami Kabab at home:

Ingredients:
1. 500g ground lamb or beef
2. 1 large onion, finely chopped
3. 2-3 green chilies, finely chopped
4. 2 inches ginger, grated
5. 2 cloves garlic, minced
6. 1 cup fresh cilantro, finely chopped
7. 2 tablespoons lemon juice
8. 2 tablespoons garam masala
9. 1 tablespoon red chili powder
10. 1 teaspoon cumin powder
11. 1 teaspoon coriander powder
12. Salt to taste
13. 2 slices of white bread, soaked in water and squeezed dry (optional)
14. 2-3 tablespoons oil for frying

Instructions:
1. In a large bowl, combine the ground meat, chopped onion, green chilies, ginger, garlic, cilantro, lemon juice, garam masala, red chili powder, cumin powder, coriander powder, and salt. Mix well until the ingredients are evenly distributed.
2. If using, add the soaked and squeezed bread to the meat mixture. This helps to bind the kababs together.
3. Using your hands, shape the mixture into small, flat patties. The size of the patties is up to you, but they should be thin enough to cook evenly.
4. Heat oil in a large frying pan over medium heat. Once the oil is hot, carefully place the kababs in the pan. Do not overcrowd the pan; cook in batches if necessary.
5. Cook the kababs for about 3-4 minutes on each side, or until they are golden brown and cooked through.
6. Drain the cooked kababs on a paper towel-lined plate to absorb any excess oil.
7. Serve Shami Kabab with rice, roti, or naan, and your favorite chutney or raita.

Enjoy your homemade Shami Kabab!

Details: Prepare delicious crispy and spicy coating for your broast with National Broast Batter Mix Masala. Incredibly easy to prepare and cook. Flavorsome spices and herbs blended in a batter mix that coats the meat to perfection and brings out the classic broast look and taste at home in a matter of minutes. Serve it with fries and National’s Garlic Mayo to enhance the eating experience.
Recipe:
Broast Recipe Mix is a seasoning blend often used to make broasted chicken, a deep-fried and pressure-cooked dish. Here's a simple recipe to make Broasted Chicken using Broast Recipe Mix:

Ingredients:
1. 4-5 lbs (1.8-2.3 kg) whole chicken, cut into pieces
2. 1 (1 oz) package of Broast Recipe Mix
3. 1 1/2 cups (360 ml) buttermilk
4. Vegetable oil for frying

Instructions:
1. Rinse and pat dry the chicken pieces. Place them in a large bowl.
2. In a separate bowl, mix the Broast Recipe Mix with 1 1/2 cups of buttermilk to form a marinade.
3. Pour the marinade over the chicken pieces, making sure they are fully coated. Cover the bowl and refrigerate for at least 1 hour or up to overnight.
4. Heat the vegetable oil in a deep fryer or a large, deep pot to 350°F (175°C).
5. Remove the chicken pieces from the marinade, letting any excess drip off.
6. Fry the chicken pieces in batches for about 10-12 minutes, or until they are golden brown and cooked through. The internal temperature of the chicken should reach 165°F (74°C).
7. Drain the fried chicken on paper towels to remove excess oil.
8. Serve the Broasted Chicken hot with your favorite dipping sauce.

Enjoy your Broasted Chicken! Remember, you can adjust the seasoning to your taste by adding more Broast Recipe Mix to the buttermilk marinade, if desired.
Ingredients: 1. 4-5 lbs (1.8-2.3 kg) whole chicken, cut into pieces
2. 1 (1 oz) package of Broast Recipe Mix

Details: Indulge in a traditional BBQ by using National’s Chapli Kabab Mix to create signature kebabs with the perfect blend of hot spices for delicious tender meat. Now you can enjoy authentic spicy and delicious chapli kebabs at home without the extra hassle.
Recipe:
Chapli Kabab Recipe Mix is a convenient product that contains a blend of spices and other ingredients to make Chapli Kababs, a popular dish from Pakistan and Afghanistan. Here's a simple recipe using Chapli Kabab Recipe Mix:

Ingredients:
1. Chapli Kabab Recipe Mix (as per package instructions)
2. 500g ground beef or lamb
3. 1 large onion, finely chopped
4. 2-3 green chilies, finely chopped (adjust according to taste)
5. 2-3 cloves of garlic, minced
6. 1 inch ginger, grated
7. 2-3 tablespoons of fresh cilantro, finely chopped
8. 2-3 tablespoons of oil for frying
9. Salt to taste

Instructions:
1. In a large bowl, combine the ground meat, chopped onion, chilies, garlic, ginger, and cilantro. Add the Chapli Kabab Recipe Mix as per the package instructions. Mix well to ensure all the ingredients are evenly distributed and the meat is well-seasoned.
2. Divide the meat mixture into equal portions and shape them into flat patties, about 1/2 inch thick.
3. Heat oil in a non-stick frying pan over medium heat. Place the Chapli Kabab patties in the pan and cook until both sides are golden brown and cooked through. This usually takes about 3-4 minutes per side, but you may need to adjust the heat as needed.
4. Drain the cooked Chapli Kababs on a paper towel to remove excess oil.
5. Serve the Chapli Kababs hot with a side of rice, naan bread, or your favorite salad. They also pair well with chutneys or yogurt sauce.

Enjoy your Chapli Kababs! Please remember that the specific quantities for the Chapli Kabab Recipe Mix may vary based on the brand, so always follow the instructions on the package.

4. 2-3 green chilies, finely chopped (adjust according to taste)
7. 2-3 tablespoons of fresh cilantro, finely chopped

Details: Looking for a convenient Haleem Mix with an authentic Haleem flavor? Look no further than National\’s Quick Cook Haleem. This recipe mix is a blend of spices and lentils that will help you cook traditional Haleem in no time.
Recipe:
Quick Cook Haleem is a convenient ready-made product that simulates the traditional Haleem dish, which is a popular dish in many Middle Eastern and South Asian cuisines. It's typically made with wheat, meat, lentils, and spices. Since Quick Cook Haleem is already prepared, no additional cooking is required. However, you can heat it up and serve it with some garnishes to enhance its flavor. Here's how you can do it:

Ingredients:
1. 1 pack of Quick Cook Haleem
2. Water (as directed on the package)
3. Ghee or oil (optional)
4. Chopped onions, coriander leaves, and fried onions (for garnish)

Instructions:
1. Open the pack of Quick Cook Haleem and empty it into a large pot.
2. Follow the instructions on the package for the amount of water needed. Generally, it's 1 part Haleem to 2 parts water.
3. Place the pot on medium heat and stir continuously until the Haleem is fully heated and reaches your desired consistency. This usually takes about 5-10 minutes. If you prefer a thinner consistency, you can add more water.
4. If you like, you can sauté some chopped onions in ghee or oil and serve them on top of the Haleem for extra flavor.
5. Garnish with chopped coriander leaves and fried onions before serving.

Enjoy your Quick Cook Haleem! Remember, the exact cooking time and amount of water may vary slightly based on the specific brand and your personal preference. Follow the instructions on the package for the most accurate results.

Details: Prepare delicious authentic Haleem with National. A blend of spices, lentils mix and your choice of meat, stirred and cooked to perfection to make this wholesome meal for any event.
Recipe:
Haleem Recipe Mix is a convenient way to prepare the traditional Middle Eastern dish Haleem, which is a type of meat and wheat porridge. Here's a simple recipe using Haleem Recipe Mix:

Ingredients:
1. Haleem Recipe Mix (as per package instructions)
2. 1 liter of water
3. 2 cups of meat (lamb, beef, or chicken, cooked and shredded)
4. 1 cup of chopped vegetables (such as carrots, peas, and potatoes)
5. 2 tablespoons of ghee or vegetable oil
6. 2 onions, finely chopped
7. 2 cloves of garlic, minced
8. 1 inch piece of ginger, grated
9. 2 green chilies, slit
10. 1 teaspoon of cumin seeds
11. 1 teaspoon of coriander seeds
12. 1 teaspoon of garam masala
13. Salt to taste
14. Fresh coriander leaves for garnish

Instructions:
1. Heat the ghee or vegetable oil in a large pot over medium heat. Add the cumin seeds and coriander seeds and let them sizzle for a few seconds.
2. Add the chopped onions, garlic, and ginger, and sauté until they turn golden brown.
3. Add the green chilies and stir for a few seconds.
4. Add the chopped vegetables and cook until they are tender.
5. Add the Haleem Recipe Mix to the pot and mix well with the vegetables.
6. Pour in 1 liter of water and stir well.
7. Bring the mixture to a boil, then reduce the heat to low and let it simmer for 15-20 minutes, stirring occasionally.
8. Add the cooked and shredded meat to the pot and stir well.
9. Season with salt and garam masala to taste.
10. Simmer for an additional 5-10 minutes, until the mixture thickens to your desired consistency.
11. Garnish with fresh coriander leaves before serving.

Enjoy your Haleem! This dish is best served warm and can be enjoyed as a main course with flatbread or rice.
Ingredients: Here are the ingredients mentioned in the recipe:
1. Haleem Recipe Mix (as per package instructions)
3. 2 cups of meat (lamb, beef, or chicken, cooked and shredded)
4. 1 cup of chopped vegetables (such as carrots, peas, and potatoes)
5. 2 tablespoons of ghee or vegetable oil

Details: Get the familiar taste of Traditional Daighi Danedar Haleem with National. A blend of spices, lentils mix and your choice of meat, stirred to perfection to make the ideal traditional meal for any event.
Recipe:
Daigi Danedar Haleem Recipe Mix is a ready-made product that is used to make Haleem, a popular dish in many Middle Eastern and South Asian countries. Haleem is a hearty and flavorful dish made from wheat, lentils, meat, and spices.

To make Haleem using Daigi Danedar Haleem Recipe Mix, follow these steps:

Ingredients:
1. Daigi Danedar Haleem Recipe Mix (1 pack)
2. Water (as directed on the package)
3. Ghee or vegetable oil (for frying)
4. Onions (2 medium, finely chopped)
5. Garlic (2 cloves, minced)
6. Ginger (1 inch piece, grated)
7. Green chilies (2, finely chopped) (optional)
8. Meat (such as lamb, beef, or chicken) (1 lb, cut into small pieces)
9. Salt to taste
10. Garam Masala (1 tsp)
11. Coriander leaves (for garnish)

Instructions:
1. Heat ghee or vegetable oil in a large pot over medium heat. Add the chopped onions, garlic, ginger, and green chilies (if using) and sauté until the onions are golden brown.
2. Add the meat to the pot and cook until it is browned and fully cooked. Season with salt to taste.
3. Add the Daigi Danedar Haleem Recipe Mix to the pot and stir well to combine with the meat and onions.
4. Add water to the pot according to the package instructions. The mixture should be thick and not too runny.
5. Bring the mixture to a boil, then reduce heat to low and simmer for 20-25 minutes, stirring occasionally, until the mixture has thickened and the flavors have melded together.

2. 2 tablespoons vegetable oil
3. 1 medium-sized onion, finely chopped
4. 2 cloves garlic, minced
5. 1-inch piece of ginger, grated

Details: Add a unique flavor and irresistible savour to your dishes with the help of National Turmeric Powder. The rich yellow color; tempting aroma and fine texture makes this the perfect ingredient to add in your delicacies for a burst of flavor.
Recipe:
Sure, I'd be happy to help you make a dish using Turmeric Powder. One of the most popular dishes is Turmeric Rice, also known as Haldi Rice in some parts of the world. Here's a simple recipe:

**Ingredients:**
1. Basmati Rice: 2 cups
2. Turmeric Powder: 1 tsp
3. Oil: 2 tbsp
4. Mustard Seeds: 1 tsp
5. Urad Dal (Split Black Gram): 1 tbsp
6. Chana Dal (Split Chickpeas): 1 tbsp
7. Curry Leaves: A few
8. Green Chili: 1 (optional)
9. Cashews: 10-12
10. Onion: 1 medium, finely chopped
11. Garlic: 2 cloves, finely chopped
12. Ginger: 1 inch piece, finely chopped
13. Salt: To taste
14. Water: 3 1/2 cups
15. Lemon Juice: 1 tbsp
16. Fresh Coriander Leaves: For garnish

**Instructions:**
1. Rinse the rice under running water until the water runs clear. Soak the rice in water for 30 minutes. Drain and set aside.
2. Heat oil in a large pot over medium heat. Add mustard seeds, urad dal, chana dal, and curry leaves. Let them sizzle for a few seconds.
3. Add the green chili and cashews. Stir until the cashews turn golden brown.
4. Add the onion, garlic, and ginger. Sauté until the onion turns translucent.
5. Add the turmeric powder and stir for a few seconds.
6. Add the drained rice to the pot, mix well to ensure the rice is coated with the spices.
7. Add salt and water. Stir once and bring the water to a boil.
8. Reduce the heat to low, cover, and let it cook for 18-20 minutes or until the rice is fully cooked and the water has been absorbed.
9. Turn off the heat and let it sit for 5 minutes with the lid on.
10. Fluff the rice with a fork, add lemon juice, and mix well.
11. Garnish with fresh coriander leaves and serve hot.

Enjoy your Turmeric Rice! Turmeric is known for its anti-inflammatory properties and has a unique flavor that adds a nice twist to plain rice.

Details: National Foods provides you with the finest and most exquisite seasonings and condiments. National Garam Masala is a blend of premium spices which gives a unique flavor and irresistible aroma to your dishes.
Recipe:
Garam Masala is a popular Indian spice blend that adds a warm, aromatic flavor to various dishes. Here's a simple recipe for making Chicken Curry using Garam Masala. This dish is rich in flavors and can be served with basmati rice or naan bread.

Ingredients:
1. 1 kg boneless chicken breasts or thighs, cut into bite-sized pieces
2. 3 tablespoons vegetable oil
3. 1 large onion, finely chopped
4. 2 cloves garlic, minced
5. 1 inch ginger, grated
6. 2 green chilies, sliced (adjust according to spice tolerance)
7. 1 tablespoon tomato paste
8. 2 medium tomatoes, diced
9. 1 tablespoon Garam Masala
10. 1 teaspoon turmeric powder
11. 1 teaspoon cumin powder
12. 1 teaspoon coriander powder
13. 1 teaspoon paprika
14. 1 teaspoon cayenne pepper (optional)
15. 1 can (400ml) coconut milk
16. Salt to taste
17. Fresh cilantro for garnish

Instructions:
1. Heat oil in a large pan over medium heat. Add chopped onions and sauté until they become translucent.
2. Add minced garlic, grated ginger, and sliced green chilies to the pan and cook for a minute.
3. Add the tomato paste and diced tomatoes, stir well and cook until the tomatoes are softened.
4. Stir in Garam Masala, turmeric powder, cumin powder, coriander powder, paprika, and cayenne pepper (if using). Mix well to coat the onions and tomatoes.
5. Add the chicken to the pan, stir well to coat it in the spice mixture. Cook until the chicken is lightly browned.
6. Pour the coconut milk into the pan, stir well, and bring the mixture to a boil. Reduce the heat to low, cover the pan, and let it simmer for 30 minutes.
7. Season with salt to taste. Stir in fresh cilantro just before serving.

Enjoy your Chicken Curry with Garam Masala! This dish can be stored in the refrigerator for up to 3 days or frozen for up to 2 months.
Ingredients: 1. 1 kg boneless chicken breasts or thighs, cut into bite-sized pieces
6. 2 green chilies, sliced (adjust according to spice tolerance)

Details: National’s Chilli Powder adds the perfect amount of pungency and hotness to your dishes and gives them a burst of flavor. Made from pure and fresh spices, gives this a natural red color. The spiciness will enhance the taste of your dishes, especially Pakistani cuisines.
Recipe:
Ingredients:
1. 2 tablespoons of Chilli Powder
2. 1 tablespoon of Olive Oil
3. 1 large Onion, finely chopped
4. 2 cloves of Garlic, minced
5. 1 can of Diced Tomatoes (14.5 oz)
6. 1 can of Kidney Beans (15 oz), drained and rinsed
7. 1 can of Black Beans (15 oz), drained and rinsed
8. 1 bell pepper, seeded and chopped
9. 1 jalapeno, seeded and minced (optional, for extra heat)
10. 1 teaspoon of Cumin
11. 1 teaspoon of Salt
12. 1 can of Chili Beans (15 oz) (optional, for more beans)
13. Sour Cream, shredded cheese, and chopped cilantro for toppings (optional)

Chili Powder Chili Recipe:

Recipe:

**Ingredients:**
1. 500g boneless, skinless chicken breasts, cut into 1-inch cubes
2. 4 tbsp Greek yogurt
3. 1 tbsp lemon juice
4. 2 tbsp coriander powder
5. 1 tbsp garam masala
6. 1 tbsp paprika
7. 2 tsp cumin seeds
8. 2 tsp garlic paste
9. 1 tsp salt
10. 2 tbsp vegetable oil
11. 1 large onion, finely chopped
12. 2 cloves garlic, minced
13. 1 tbsp ginger paste
14. 1 can (400g) chopped tomatoes
15. 1 tbsp tomato paste
16. 1 tsp chili powder
17. 1 tsp turmeric
18. 1 tsp ground cumin
19. 1 tsp coriander powder
20. 1 cup heavy cream
21. 2 tbsp chopped fresh cilantro
22. Salt to taste

**Instructions:**
1. In a large bowl, combine the chicken cubes, yogurt, lemon juice, 2 tbsp coriander powder, garam masala, paprika, cumin seeds, garlic paste, and salt. Mix well to ensure all the chicken pieces are well coated. Cover and refrigerate for at least 2 hours.
2. Preheat your oven to 400°F (200°C) and line a baking sheet with parchment paper.
3. Remove the chicken from the marinade and shake off any excess. Arrange the chicken pieces on the baking sheet and bake for 15-20 minutes, or until the chicken is cooked through.
4. While the chicken is baking, heat the oil in a large pan over medium heat. Add the onion and cook until softened, about 5 minutes. Add the minced garlic and ginger paste and cook for another minute.
5. Add the chopped tomatoes, tomato paste, chili powder, turmeric, ground cumin, 1 tsp coriander powder, and salt. Stir well and let it simmer for 10 minutes.
6. Once the chicken is done, add it to the pan with the tomato sauce and stir to coat. Let it simmer for another 5 minutes.
7. Stir in the heavy cream and let it heat through. Taste and adjust the seasoning if necessary.
8. Remove from heat and stir in the fresh cilantro. Serve with rice or naan bread.

Enjoy your Chicken Tikka Masala!

1. 500g boneless, skinless chicken breasts, cut into 1-inch cubes

Details: National Foods provides you with the finest and most exquisite seasonings and condiments. National’s Cumin Seeds are loaded with antioxidants and nutrients that are beneficial for your health. Make your dishes more flavorsome and aromatic with the help of our Cumin Seeds.
Recipe:
Recipe: Cumin Seeds Temperature-Controlled Rice (Pulao)

Ingredients:
1. 2 cups of basmati rice
2. 4 cups of water
3. 2 tablespoons of Ghee or vegetable oil
4. 1 large onion, finely chopped
5. 2 cloves of garlic, minced
6. 1 inch piece of ginger, minced
7. 1 green chili, chopped (optional)
8. 1 teaspoon of turmeric powder
9. 2 tablespoons of cumin seeds
10. 1.5 cups of mixed vegetables (peas, carrots, and corn)
11. Salt, to taste
12. 1 bunch of fresh coriander leaves, finely chopped
13. 1 lemon, cut into wedges for serving

Instructions:
1. Rinse the basmati rice under cold water until the water runs clear. Set aside.
2. Heat 1 tablespoon of ghee or vegetable oil in a large, heavy-bottomed pot over medium heat. Add the cumin seeds and let them sizzle for about 30 seconds.
3. Add the chopped onion, garlic, ginger, and green chili (if using). Sauté until the onion turns golden brown, stirring frequently to prevent burning.
4. Add the turmeric powder and mixed vegetables. Stir well and cook for 2-3 minutes.
5. Add the rinsed basmati rice to the pot. Stir well to coat the rice with the oil and spices.
6. Pour in 4 cups of water and salt to taste. Stir once more, then cover the pot and bring the mixture to a boil.
7. Once boiling, reduce the heat to low, and let it simmer for 12-15 minutes, or until most of the water has been absorbed and the rice is cooked.
8. Remove the pot from the heat and let it sit, covered, for 5-10 minutes to allow the steam to finish cooking the rice.
9. Fluff the rice with a fork, then mix in the chopped coriander leaves.
10. Serve the cumin seeds temperature-controlled rice with lemon wedges on the side.

Enjoy your Cumin Seeds Temperature-Controlled Rice!
Ingredients: Here are all the ingredients mentioned in the recipe:
3. 2 tablespoons of Ghee or vegetable oil
10. 1.5 cups of mixed vegetables (peas, carrots, and corn)
12. 1 bunch of fresh coriander leaves, finely chopped

Details: This multi-purpose herb provides a fragrant aroma and rich flavor by transforming your meals by adding a sweetness and depth of flavour to any dish. Typically, Kasuri Methi pairs well with potatoes and is used to make “Aloo Methi”. It is also used in doughs for Parathas and Naan and is sprinkled over curries with meat.
Recipe:
Kasuri Methi, also known as dried fenugreek leaves, is a popular ingredient in Indian cuisine. It adds a unique flavor and aroma to dishes. Here's a simple recipe for making a popular Indian side dish called Methi Paratha using Kasuri Methi.

Ingredients:
1. 2 cups whole wheat flour (atta)
2. 1 cup finely crushed Kasuri Methi
3. 1 medium-sized onion, finely chopped
4. 2 green chilies, finely chopped
5. 1 tablespoon grated ginger
6. 2 tablespoons oil + extra for cooking
7. Salt to taste
8. Water for kneading the dough

Instructions:
1. In a large bowl, mix the crushed Kasuri Methi, chopped onions, green chilies, grated ginger, and salt.
2. Add 2 tablespoons of oil and mix everything well.
3. Knead a soft dough using the prepared mixture and enough water. Make sure the dough is not too sticky.
4. Divide the dough into small balls.
5. Roll out each ball into a thin circle, about 6 inches in diameter.
6. Apply a little oil to one side of the circle.
7. Place the vegetable and Kasuri Methi mixture in the center of the circle.
8. Fold the circle in half, bringing the oiled side over the filling. Press the edges gently to seal.
9. Press the edges again with a fork to ensure they don't open while cooking.
10. Heat a non-stick tava or griddle over medium heat. Place the paratha on it and cook for about 2 minutes on each side, or until golden brown spots appear.
11. Apply oil on both sides and press gently with a spatula during cooking, if needed.
12. Repeat the process with the remaining dough balls.
13. Serve Methi Paratha hot with curd or raita.

Enjoy your homemade Methi Paratha!
Ingredients: Sure, here are all the ingredients mentioned in the recipe:
2. 1 cup finely crushed Kasuri Methi (dried fenugreek leaves)

Details: National Foods Limited is the pioneer of branded spices in clean packaged form in Pakistan. We ensure that you get the purest spices by selecting only the finest raw materials and maintaining strict quality control at our state-of-the art manufacturing facilities. National Black Pepper gives the perfect hot flavor to your dishes.
Recipe:
Black pepper powder is a versatile spice commonly used in various dishes around the world. Here are two simple recipes using black pepper powder:

1. Black Pepper Chicken
Ingredients:
- 500g boneless chicken breast, cut into cubes
- 2 tablespoons soy sauce
- 1 tablespoon cornstarch
- 2 tablespoons vegetable oil
- 1 large onion, finely chopped
- 3 cloves garlic, minced
- 1 inch ginger, grated
- 1 bell pepper, cut into strips
- 2 medium carrots, sliced
- 2 tablespoons black pepper powder
- 2 cups of mixed vegetables (like snap peas, snow peas, and bell peppers)
- 2 green onions, chopped
- 2 tablespoons oyster sauce (optional)

Instructions:
1. Mix chicken cubes, soy sauce, and cornstarch in a bowl. Let it marinate for 30 minutes.
2. Heat oil in a large skillet or wok over medium-high heat. Add marinated chicken and cook until browned. Remove from skillet and set aside.
3. In the same skillet, add onion, garlic, and ginger. Sauté for 2 minutes until fragrant.
4. Add bell pepper, carrots, and mixed vegetables. Stir-fry for 5-7 minutes until vegetables are tender.
5. Add black pepper powder, stir well, and cook for 1 minute.
6. Return the cooked chicken to the skillet, mix well, and cook for another minute.
7. If desired, add oyster sauce and stir to coat the chicken and vegetables.
8. Serve hot over steamed rice, garnished with chopped green onions.

2. Black Pepper Steak
Ingredients:
- 2 steaks (like sirloin or ribeye), about 1-inch thick
- 2 tablespoons olive oil
- 2 tablespoons butter
- 2 tablespoons black pepper powder
- Salt to taste
- 2 cloves garlic, minced
- 2 sprigs fresh rosemary (optional)

Instructions:
1. Season both sides of the steaks with salt and black pepper powder.
2. Heat olive oil in a large skillet over high heat. Once the oil is hot, add the steaks.
3. Cook the steaks for 3-4 minutes on each side for medium-rare. Adjust cooking time based on your desired doneness.
4. Remove the steaks from the skillet and set aside to rest for 5-10 minutes.
5. In the same skillet, add butter, garlic, and rosemary (if using). Swirl the pan to melt the butter and infuse it with garlic and rosemary flavor.
6. Slice the rested steaks and pour the garlic butter over them before serving.

Details: National Garlic Powder is a great addition to make your dishes exceedingly appetizing and aromatic. Our fine textured Garlic Powder is the perfect choice to add to your cooking because it enhances the overall flavour of your dish.
Recipe:
Garlic powder is a versatile ingredient used in various dishes to add flavor. Here's a simple recipe for Garlic Roasted Chicken, which is a great way to utilize garlic powder.

Ingredients:
1. 1 whole chicken (around 4 lbs)
2. 2 teaspoons of garlic powder
3. 1 teaspoon of salt
4. 1 teaspoon of black pepper
5. 2 tablespoons of olive oil
6. 2 tablespoons of lemon juice
7. 2 cloves of garlic, minced (optional, if you prefer fresh garlic)
8. Fresh herbs like rosemary, thyme, or oregano (optional)

Instructions:
1. Preheat your oven to 400°F (200°C).
2. Rinse the chicken inside and out, then pat it dry with paper towels.
3. In a small bowl, combine the garlic powder, salt, pepper, and minced garlic (if using).
4. Rub the seasoning mixture all over the chicken, making sure to cover the outside and inside cavities.
5. Place the chicken in a roasting pan and drizzle it with olive oil.
6. Squeeze the lemon juice over the chicken, then rub it in. If using fresh herbs, sprinkle them inside the chicken's cavity.
7. Tie the legs together with kitchen twine, if desired, for even cooking.
8. Roast the chicken in the preheated oven for about 1 hour and 15 minutes, or until the internal temperature reaches 165°F (74°C) in the thickest part of the thigh.
9. Remove the chicken from the oven and let it rest for 10 minutes before carving and serving.

Enjoy your Garlic Roasted Chicken! Remember, you can adjust the quantity of garlic powder according to your taste preferences.
Ingredients: 8. Fresh herbs like rosemary, thyme, or oregano (optional)
9. Kitchen twine (for tying the legs together, if desired)

Details: National iodized Refined salt is a specially refined; brilliant white food grade salt with free flow properties. Enjoy great tasting and healthy food prepared with National iodized Refined Salt.
Recipe:
Refined salt, also known as table salt, is a common cooking ingredient used to enhance the flavor of dishes. Here are a few recipes using refined salt:

1. Basic Salted Popcorn:
   Ingredients:
   - 1/2 cup popcorn kernels
   - 2-3 tablespoons vegetable oil
   - 1/4 cup refined salt

   Instructions:
   - Heat 2-3 tablespoons of vegetable oil in a large, heavy-bottomed pot over medium heat.
   - Add 3-4 popcorn kernels and cover the pot. Once the kernels pop, it's time to add the rest of the kernels.
   - Shake the pot constantly to prevent the popcorn from burning. Once the popping slows down, remove the pot from heat and let the popping stop completely.
   - Sprinkle 1/4 cup of refined salt over the popped popcorn and gently stir to evenly distribute.

2. Garlic Salt:
   Ingredients:
   - 1/2 cup refined salt
   - 4-5 large cloves of garlic, minced

   Instructions:
   - In a small bowl, mix 1/2 cup of refined salt with 4-5 minced garlic cloves.
   - Store the garlic salt in an airtight container and use it to season your dishes.

3. Homemade Salted Butter:
   Ingredients:
   - 1 lb unsalted butter, softened
   - 1-2 tablespoons refined salt

   Instructions:
   - Use a stand mixer or hand mixer to beat the softened unsalted butter until it's light and fluffy.
   - Gradually add 1-2 tablespoons of refined salt, depending on your taste preference, while continuously mixing.
   - Transfer the salted butter to an airtight container and store in the refrigerator.

Details: National iodized Salt is a specially refined; brilliant white food grade salt. It includes essential iodine which helps in the proper mental development of children and prevents iodine deficiency in adults.
Recipe:
Iodized refined salt is a common ingredient in various dishes worldwide, especially in cooking and baking. It's essential for enhancing the taste of food and balancing flavors. Here are a few recipes where iodized refined salt is used:

1. Basic Salted Butter Popcorn
Ingredients:
- 1/2 cup popcorn kernels
- 3 tablespoons vegetable oil
- 1/2 cup popcorn salt (or regular iodized salt)
- 2-3 tablespoons melted butter

Instructions:
1. Heat 3 tablespoons of vegetable oil in a large, heavy-bottomed pot over medium-high heat.
2. Once the oil is hot, add 3-4 popcorn kernels. When those kernels pop, it means your oil is ready.
3. Add the 1/2 cup of popcorn kernels to the pot, cover it, and shake the pot gently to distribute the kernels evenly.
4. Cook the popcorn, shaking the pot occasionally, until the popping slows down to one or two seconds between pops.
5. Remove the pot from heat.
6. In a small bowl, melt the butter.
7. Pour the melted butter over the popped popcorn and sprinkle the popcorn salt evenly. Toss the popcorn to coat it well.
8. Serve in bowls and enjoy your salted butter popcorn.

2. Homemade French Fries
Ingredients:
- 4 large russet potatoes, peeled and cut into 1/3-inch thick sticks
- Vegetable oil for frying
- 2-3 tablespoons iodized salt

Instructions:
1. Rinse the potato sticks under cold water to remove excess starch. Pat them dry using a kitchen towel.
2. Heat 3-4 inches of vegetable oil in a deep fryer or heavy-bottomed pot to 325 degrees F (165 degrees C).
3. Fry the potato sticks in batches for about 3-4 minutes, until softened.
4. Remove the fries from the oil and drain on paper towels. Allow them to cool slightly.
5. Increase the oil temperature to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C).
6. Fry the potato sticks in batches again for 1-2 minutes, until golden brown and crispy.
7. Drain the fries on paper towels, sprinkle with iodized salt, and serve warm.

Recipe:
Mango Pickle is a versatile ingredient that can add a unique flavor to various dishes. Here's a simple recipe for using Mango Pickle in a curry:

Ingredients:
1. 2 tablespoons of Mango Pickle
2. 1 lb boneless chicken (cut into cubes)
3. 1 large onion (finely chopped)
4. 2 cloves of garlic (minced)
5. 1 inch piece of ginger (grated)
6. 1 green chili (slit)
7. 1 teaspoon cumin seeds
8. 1 teaspoon coriander seeds

7. Add the tomato puree and garam masala. Stir well and cook until the oil separates from the gravy.

Details: National Crushed Pickles offers a perfectly balanced taste of crushed mixed vegetables in every bite, making it the perfect meal companion. Its unique crushed format makes it easy to eat and allows you to pair it up with anything and everything. Whether used as a condiment, stuffing, topping, ingredient for cooking or even as a spread over paratha, National Crushed Pickle will add just the right excitement to your meal! It is packed in a convenient jar with foil seal which helps keep the freshness intact.
Recipe:
Recipe: Pickle Relish Slaw

Ingredients:
1. 1 lb (450g) shredded cabbage (green and purple cabbages work well)
2. 1/2 cup (120ml) crushed pickles
3. 1/4 cup (60ml) pickle juice from the jar
4. 1/4 cup (59ml) mayonnaise
5. 2 tbsp (30g) sugar
6. 1 tbsp (15g) white vinegar
7. 1 tbsp (15g) mustard (yellow or Dijon, your preference)
8. 1 tsp (5g) salt
9. 1/2 tsp (2.5g) black pepper
10. 2 green onions, thinly sliced
11. 1/2 cup (60g) chopped red bell pepper

Instructions:
1. In a large bowl, combine the shredded cabbage, crushed pickles, and sliced green onions. Set aside.
2. In a separate bowl, whisk together the pickle juice, mayonnaise, sugar, white vinegar, mustard, salt, and black pepper until well combined.
3. Pour the dressing over the cabbage mixture and toss until evenly coated.
4. Add the chopped red bell pepper and mix well.
5. Allow the slaw to chill in the refrigerator for at least 30 minutes before serving, preferably overnight, to allow the flavors to meld together.
6. Serve the pickle relish slaw as a side dish with barbecue, grilled meats, or sandwiches.

Enjoy your pickle relish slaw!

1. 1 lb (450g) shredded cabbage (green and purple cabbages work well)

Recipe:
Hyderabadi Mixed Pickle is a ready-to-use condiment, often made with a mix of various fruits and vegetables that have been fermented and preserved in oil. It is usually spicy and tangy in flavor. Here are some common ways to use Hyderabadi Mixed Pickle in cooking:

1. As a side dish: Hyderabadi Mixed Pickle can be served as a side dish with Indian meals. It pairs well with rice, roti, naan, or any other type of Indian bread.

2. In salads: The pickle can be added to vegetable or fruit salads to give them an extra kick of flavor.

3. In chutneys: Hyderabadi Mixed Pickle can be used as a base for making chutneys. You can blend the pickle with other ingredients like tamarind, garlic, and green chilies to make a spicy and tangy chutney.

4. In curries: The pickle can be added to curries to enhance their flavor. It works well with curries made with lentils, paneer, or vegetables.

Since Hyderabadi Mixed Pickle is a ready-made product, no recipe is needed for its use. However, if you're looking for a specific recipe that uses the pickle, you might want to consider one of the options mentioned above and adjust the ingredients and quantities according to your taste.
Ingredients: Since Hyderabadi Mixed Pickle is a ready-to-use condiment, it is not made at home and therefore, no specific ingredients are provided in the recipe. However, the pickle typically contains a mix of various fruits and vegetables that have been fermented and preserved in oil, often with spices like turmeric, chili, and mustard seeds. The exact ingredients can vary depending on the specific brand or recipe.

Details: National Classic Mayo is made from premium quality natural ingredients and high grade procedures which makes it thick, creamy and flavorsome. Made with real eggs, National Classic Mayo offers the authentic taste of Mayonnaise along with essential nutrients such as Omega 3 & 6 and Vitamin A. Our Mayo can be used as a spread for burgers, sandwiches and wraps and also as a dip for fries. National products are carefully packaged under strict hygienic conditions, ensuring quality at every step of the process.
Recipe:
Recipe: Classic Mayo-Based Coleslaw

Ingredients:
1. 1 head of cabbage (green or a mix of green and red), shredded
2. 1 large carrot, grated
3. 1 small red onion, finely chopped
4. 1/2 cup Classic Mayo
5. 2 tablespoons white vinegar
6. 2 tablespoons sugar
7. 1 teaspoon salt
8. 1/2 teaspoon ground black pepper

Instructions:
1. In a large bowl, combine the shredded cabbage, grated carrot, and finely chopped red onion.
2. In a separate smaller bowl, mix together the Classic Mayo, white vinegar, sugar, salt, and ground black pepper. Whisk until well combined.
3. Pour the mayonnaise dressing over the cabbage, carrot, and onion mixture.
4. Using clean hands or a large spoon, gently mix the coleslaw until the vegetables are evenly coated with the dressing.
5. Cover the bowl and refrigerate for at least 1 hour before serving to allow the flavors to meld together.
6. Enjoy your Classic Mayo-Based Coleslaw as a side dish with barbecue, burgers, or sandwiches.

Enjoy your cooking!
Ingredients: 1. 1 head of cabbage (green or a mix of green and red)

Details: National Garlic Mayo is a delicious blend of Garlic and Mayonnaise which will perfectly complement your snacks and meals. It is made from premium quality natural ingredients which makes it thick, creamy and flavorsome. Prepared with real eggs, National Garlic Mayo offers essential nutrients such as Omega 3 & 6 and Vitamin A. Recipe:
Garlic Mayo can be used in various dishes to add a flavorful twist. Here's a simple recipe for Garlic Mayo Aioli, which is often used as a dip or a sauce for vegetables, sandwiches, or grilled meats.

Ingredients:
1. 1 cup Mayonnaise
2. 2 cloves Garlic, minced
3. 1 teaspoon Lemon juice
4. Salt and Pepper to taste

Instructions:
1. In a small bowl, combine the mayonnaise, minced garlic, and lemon juice.
2. Stir until well mixed.
3. Season with salt and pepper to taste.
4. If you prefer a smoother texture, you can use an immersion blender to blend the mixture until smooth.
5. Store in an airtight container in the refrigerator for up to a week.

Enjoy your Garlic Mayo Aioli! It's delicious on sandwiches, as a dip for fries or vegetables, or as a sauce for grilled meats.
